reviewText: I am an advanced exerciser, so with that said, this was a little "low energy" for me - BUT - I was looking for something to supplement my morning workout, that I could do in the evening, that would not require a lot of time. This is it! It is challenging enough for an evening workout to keep my metabolism revved up for night time fat burning. So I am pleased with the purchase/DVD. If you are an intermediate to advanced exerciser, this might be too easy for a main workout. I am using this with Jillian Michael's more advanced exercises that I do in the morning. I love the Firm videos though - :)
summary: Nice for beginners or if you want a "short" workout!

reviewText: This video is high energy, with easy moves. There's no dancing or frilly moves, just awesome and hard core cardio. I love it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've been experimenting with 3 different workout DVDs this month:1.10 Minute Solution: 5 Day Get Fit Mix2.  The Spark: Fit, Firm & Fired Up in 10 Minutes a Day3.Firm: Turbocharge Weight LossPoint of reference - I'm middle-aged, work out at a gym regularly, and am in good cardio shape.  I use workout DVDs at home when I can't get to the gym or just don't feel like going.  Of these 3 DVDs, The Firm is my least favorite.  I would not buy it again.  I disagree with the reviewer who said it's good for beginners.  I consider myself of average coordination, but I found this workout to be too fast and complicated for me.  I've tried it several times but each time quick frustration has led me to turn it off within 2 minutes of starting.  I like the10 Minute Solution: 5 Day Get Fit Mixand The Spark: Fit, Firm & Fired Up in 10 Minutes a Day workouts much better.  They are good for beginners and/or for days when you feel crummy and 10 minutes is just all you can bring yourself to do.  I typically do 3 or 4 of the 10-min. segments on those DVDs for a complete workout.  I also really like the trainers on those DVDs (Amy Bento and Coach Nicole).  They are encouraging without being overly perky. You get the feeling that they know where you are at and it's okay.  The Firm trainers are a little too intense for me.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love both of the segments in this video! The first one has more weights and is lower impact, and the second one is mostly cardio with some weight lifting. Very fun and great instruction! I do the first one when I want something low impact and I do the second one when I want something to really challenge me.

reviewText: I am very ambitious when it comes to getting into shape but often I aim too high. In other words, I am a woman in my mid-40's, who needs to lose about 60 pounds, and who has a very busy schedule. However, I will often buy a DVD that is above my current level of fitness because I am inspired when I see the preview. I own all of Jillian's DVDs, a few of Cathe's..etc. But they are too hard and my endurance level is not there yet. So, I get discouraged when I can't keep up so I just stop doing them due to the dread factor and/or feeling like a failure.That's why I LOVE THESE 20 MINUTE DVDs FROM THE FIRM!!! I know that I can make a commitment of 20 minutes 4-5 days per week and not feel like I am cheating myself and not getting a really good workout BECAUSE I AM DRIPPING IN SWEAT AND I CAN FEEL IT ALL OVER THE NEXT DAY. I purchased Ignite and Turbocharge and let me tell you - they are kickin my butt! I am actually working out harder because I am carrying extra weight and the interval training is more effective with someone who is overweight - you will see results faster. [I know because I hired a personal trainer last year who I worked out with for 3 days per week for only 30 minute sessions and we did interval training. I lost about 23 pounds in 3 months and I saw results immediately.] Interval training is the way to go and you don't have to work out for an hour to get results!!Yes, it does move quite fast but I didn't have any problems catching on...I think that once you go through it once or twice you will be fine. They are also just fun! There's no dread factor. Emily is very perky but I can handle her for only 20 minutes. Rebekah is great with giving cues...her squealing "whoo!" every 10 seconds is a bit annoying but now I just chuckle at it. Allison is on the other DVD and she is great, great cues, fun and different moves...she has that southern drawl but, again, it's ok for only 20 minutes...I just chuckle and find it entertaining.For all of you big girls who feel intimidated by Jillian, Cathe and the like...look at these Firm DVDs as a way to work up to those. I am telling myself that when I can consistenly do 4-5 workouts each week AND get through the 20 minutes without hitting "pause" then I am ready for Jillian.I am on my way!!! "WHOO!!"--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
summary: There's Hope for Us BIG Girls!!!
Title: N/A
